When the storage capacity of an EBS volume is increased, the additional space is not automatically reflected in the file system. The file system needs to be extended to utilize the newly allocated space.
By extending the file system, the EC2 instance will be able to utilize the increased storage capacity of the EBS volume. No need to restart the instance or detach/reattach the volume.

Note: Before performing any modifications on the file system, it is always recommended to take a backup or snapshot of the volume for data protection.
